sentences.english: There was a moment of silence, then everyone but the Princess began to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 片刻寂静之后，皇族贵胄们哄堂大笑，除了公主。

sentences.english: Men of the sword had overthrown nobles and kings.
sentences.chinese: 手执利剑的人已经推翻了王室贵胄。

sentences.english: O king of Assyria, your shepherds slumber; your nobles lie down to rest.
sentences.chinese: 亚述王阿，你的牧人睡觉，你的贵胄安歇。

sentences.english: He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.
sentences.chinese: 有一个贵胄往远方去，要得国回来。

sentences.english: Gui Zhou calls in gold coin very grouchily, award gave a head a lackey.
sentences.chinese: 贵胄很不高兴地将金币收回，奖给了头一个仆人。

sentences.english: We are young nobles, and have not yet worn our coronets.
sentences.chinese: 我们是年青的贵胄，尚未能戴上冠冕。

definition: the emperor relatives (idiom); person with powerful connections
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
high official and noble persons (idiom); the great and the good
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
royal family/imperial household/member of the royal family
family of a functionary (i.e. educated middle class in Qing times)
